intro: Carpha laxa, commonly known as the slender flat sedge, is a flowering plant native to wetland and marshy environments in North America. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and cylindrical inflorescences. The plant produces small, spikelet-based flowers that are typically wind-pollinated. Carpha laxa thrives in shallow water or damp soil, making it an important component of wetland ecosystems. Its presence is often an indicator of healthy, undisturbed aquatic habitats.
